pull.title: Add HD keypath to CKeyMetadata, report metadata in validateaddress
pull.body:
**I strongly recommend to merge this into 0.13 (current master or in 0.13 once we have split off).**

Without this PRs `CKeyMetadata` extension, we will very likely run into problem to later identify which key are HD.
Wallets in Core can always have non-hd keys along with hd-keys (through `importwallet`, `importprivkey`).

events.message: [QA] extend wallet-hd test to cover HD metadata

issue.title: [Wallet] add HD keypath to CKeyMetadata, report over validateaddress
issue.body:
Adds the HD keypath (example: `m/0'/0'/1') to the persisted CKeyMetadata object.

Currently, the used keypath scheme is still static and should be made dynamic/configurable in a different PR.

issue.title: [Wallet] keep HD seed during salvagewallet
issue.body:
Calling `-salvagewallet` (CWalletDB::Recover in keys only mode) will result in dropping the information which private key is used for hd key derivation (and also loses the child key counter).

This simple PR would try to keep  the `hdchain` record if it was available during the time when `-salvagewallet` was called.

issue.title: [qa] wallet*.py: Check for salvagewallet regressions
issue.body: This checks for the bug reported in #2480 and #8300.

events.body: Please use HD and BIPxx always in uppercase.
Am I correct that this does not conflict with #8132?

@luke-jr: I think this is incompatible with Knots implementation of "the key generation type" (similar to #8132). But, using Version 10 for the CKeyMetadata allows Knots to detect the HDness and migrate the data.
I guess Core 0.13 wallets are incompatible with Knows 0.12. But Know 0.13 can be compatible with Core 0.13.

events.message: [Wallet] comsetic non-code changes for the HD feature

events.body: Added two commits to address the nits.

issue.title: Extend RPC to be able to import and export Sapling keys
Modify validateaddress and z_validateaddress for zip32
issue.body:
As part of https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/3218 we pulled in some changes from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8323. 

We skipped the commit https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8323/commits/b1c7b244e21ba67c38fe3d1a4d1638ca52835ac5 ([Wallet] report optional HDKeypath/HDMasterKeyId in validateaddress (Jonas Schnelli)) .

Because it depended on other upstream changes we had either not pulled in or pulled in out of order, and because we will have to do additional work to incorporate similar logic into `z_validateaddress` this separate issue exists to sort that out.

issue.title: Add Sapling support to z_importwallet and z_exportwallet
issue.body:
Includes code adapted from upstream PR https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8323

Closes #3218.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -45,6 +49,9 @@ def run_test (self):
         num_hd_adds = 300
         for _ in range(num_hd_adds):
             hd_add = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
+            hd_info = self.nodes[1].validateaddress(hd_add)
+            assert_equal(hd_info["hdkeypath"], "m/0'/0'/"+str(_+1)+"'")
comments.body: Nit: underscore is usually used for unused loop variables. Mind to change it to a single char?
I could imagine this will bloat wallet.dat a bit?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2269,6 +2269,7 @@ UniValue getwalletinfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  \"keypoolsize\": xxxx,        (numeric) how many new keys are pre-generated\n"
             "  \"unlocked_until\": ttt,      (numeric) the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked\n"
             "  \"paytxfee\": x.xxxx,         (numeric) the transaction fee configuration, set in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB\n"
+            "  \"masterkeyid\": \"<hash160>\", (string) the Hash160 of the hd master pubkey\n"

comments.body: 5% to 10% increase in wallet.dat size, it seems.
I guess its around ~30bytes per pubkey. I think this is acceptable.
any reason hdMasterKeyID isn't set null here

Good catch. Thanks.
Added a commit to address this: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8323/commits/68d7682b9f8c0f548e0a9ef03296320b8ae3960d
